not renew an illusion we have once seen through. 
"So you have never noticed before how beau- tiful I am?" Hlene seemed to say. "You had not noticed that I am a woman? Yes, I am a wom- an who may belong to anyone to you too," said her glance. And at that moment Pierre felt that Hdene not only could, but must, be his wife, and that it could not be otherwise. 
He knew this at that moment as surely as if he had been standing at the altar with her. How and when this would be he did not know, he
